title: Ending Relationships Well
description: Navigating breakups with clarity, kindness, and integrity

modules.title: Knowing When to End
modules.description: Recognizing when a relationship should end

modules.title: The Ending Conversation
modules.description: How to have the breakup conversation with care

modules.title: Grieving and Healing
modules.description: Processing the loss and finding yourself again

questions.question: Signs that a relationship may need to end include:
options: Occasional disagreements and conflicts
Feeling consistently worse about yourself in the relationship
Finding other people attractive sometimes
Needing alone time away from your partner

questions.question: When deciding whether to end a relationship:
options: A single argument is sufficient reason to break up
You should ignore your feelings and focus only on practicalities
Clarity often emerges through honest reflection, not in the moment
The decision should be made impulsively to avoid overthinking

questions.question: A respectful breakup conversation includes:
options: Listing all their faults in detail
Being honest about your decision without being cruel
Leaving hope for reconciliation to soften the blow
Breaking up by text to avoid emotional scenes

questions.question: Immediately after a breakup, it's generally helpful to:
options: Start dating someone new right away
Maintain frequent contact with your ex
Create space and limit contact to allow both people to adjust
Pretend nothing has changed

questions.question: The grieving process after a breakup:
options: Should be avoided by staying busy
Is normal and necessary, even if you initiated the breakup
Only applies to longer relationships
Means you made the wrong decision

subtitle: Close chapters with grace and integrity
